blog.name: femnet
blog.title: Welcome to Fem Net!
blog.description: Welcome to FemNet. A blog by young ladies, for all people, about the reality of being a young woman growing up in, and under the influence of, the 21st century. Inclusive of all women, no matter their ethnicity, sexuality, gender or social status.

summary: Anyone who has Googled ‘Captain Marvel’ has probably seen the extensive criticism leveled towards the film. Even on Tumblr, the...
caption:
Anyone who has Googled ‘Captain Marvel’ has probably seen the extensive criticism leveled towards the film. Even on Tumblr, the level of vitriol against the film for either being military propaganda or a female-led superhero film is simply unbelievable. And while films should not be protected against criticism, the sheer volume of hatred that Captain Marvel has received from all genders is somewhat surprising and rather sexist. Yes, while the film depicts a female superhero, Captain Marvel is another Marvel film and adds to an extensive cinematic universe - one which has had many fans enraptured since its inception. 

Perhaps most telling is Tumblr’s reaction to the depiction of the military. The main character used to be apart of the U.S Air Force, something that the movie repeatedly emphasizes on the audience. Even pre-movie advertisements provided more military and army adverts than one would consider the norm. Personally, I’d never seen a military advertisement at the cinema - and yet prior to showing Captain Marvel, that’s what I got. However, while it is fair to criticise Marvel for using the film as an effective marketing tool for the military, it is the first time that a Marvel film has received such a spotlight on its military propaganda.

The character Captain America and his extensive involvement in the Marvel Cinematic Universe have not been met with as much distaste, despite the first film depicting him in the army and being used as a weapon of war. Even Iron Man is depicted as an individual who profits off making weapons for either side of a war. Both characters and their respective film appearances have not been put under as much scrutiny as Carol Danvers in Captain Marvel, and it raises the question of why? Both the simple and complicated answer are likely to cite misogyny, internalised or otherwise.

Moreover, the highly sexist comments that Brie Larson has received in regards to this film (such as suggestions Larson should smile more and that she has ruined the Marvel franchise) further highlight how women - even when joining a highly successful franchise - are put under more scrutiny than their male counterparts. There was much criticism leveled at Larson for her acting abilities and regardless of whether one agrees or not - the amount of hate she has received is intriguing considering her male counterparts are able to perform without any standards set upon them from (mostly male) fans.

While films should not be free from scrutiny, it is interesting that Captain Marvel is seemingly the first Marvel film to experience a level of criticism usually reserved for bad films. Even a Marvel movie that fans love to hate, Age of Ultron, did not receive this level of criticism nor the intentional dropping of ratings from said fans. And while it is disappointing that Captain Marvel has been often unreasonably criticised, it has been highly successful in the box office, disparaging fans are unable to remove their bitterness and enjoy the movie for what it is, which perhaps is truly the most disappointing part of it all.

summary: Can I request a super fluffy Carol x reader where reader is maybe an avenger too and one night Carol takes the reader flying and...
question: Can I request a super fluffy Carol x reader where reader is maybe an avenger too and one night Carol takes the reader flying and just being super cute ❤
answer:
this is cute tbh, enjoy!


“I have an idea for tonight,” Carol came up behind you, moved your hair from your neck and placed her arms around your waist.


Her head rested on your shoulder and you replied. “And what’s that Danvers,”


She smirked, you couldn’t see it but you knew she did. She loved when you called her by her last name so you did it on purpose.


You finished drying the dishes and turned around. Your hands went to either side of her head, leaned in and moved your lips against hers. You both hummed, enjoying the moment.


As much as you wanted to move this in to the bedroom, Carol had other plans. She pulled back, keeping her hands on your hips. She noticed your flushed cheeks and felt pleased with her accomplishment.


“So what do you have in mind?”


“What do you think of going for a fly?”


“Where?” you smiled, wiggling closer towards her.


“Wherever” She kissed your left cheek “you,” and then your right, “like” and one on the lips, for good measure.


With her arms wrapped around you, she took you across the earth showing you things you’d never seen before. She held you closely as she paused, hovering high up in the sky as you stared at the sun over the horizon. Surrounded by nothing but trees and mountains.


“Don’t let me go,” you whispered.


“Never,” She kissed just beside your ear.


She then took you to a mountain top, to watch the stars as they sparkled in the dark. But they weren’t what was captivating. It was Carol. It was always Carol. She was pointing out constellations and telling stories of planets far far away. The woman of your dreams really knows how to get you to fall deeper in love with you and you were more than willing to let it happen.

summary: 5 Comics the MCU Should Adapt Next
title: 5 Comics the MCU Should Adapt Next
body:
Marvel’s roster is gigantic. So where do the movies and television shows go next?

Marvel Studios and Marvel Television have amassed a gigantic roster over the years. With upcoming properties set to introduce Captain Marvel, Valkyrie, Wasp, The Runaways, The Inhumans, Cloak and Dagger and the New Warriors among others, where can Marvel go from here?

Let’s look at five properties they should adapt next.

5. Guardians 3000

Source: Marvel Unlimited. Guardians 3000 #6. Art by Alex…

View On WordPress

summary: I have this issue where I’m physically unable to pick favorite characters. For instance, I’ll decide that Loki is my favorite,...
body:
I have this issue where I’m physically unable to pick favorite characters. For instance, I’ll decide that Loki is my favorite, but wait what about Bucky? And Tony? And Natasha? And Carol? And Coulson? And Clint? And Valkyrie? And Groot? And Gamora? And almost every other character in the MCU????????

It’s basically just a never-ending cycle of indecision and self-doubt.

It’s basically just a never-ending cycle of indecision and self-doubt.

title: Shazam: Say My Name (A Moview)
body:
Shazam: Say My Name (A Moview)

The Wizard: Say my name so that my powers may flow through you.
Billy Batson: But I don’t know your name, sir.
The Wizard: Shazam.
Billy Batson: [laughing] Are you for real?
The Wizard: Say it!
Billy Batson: Okay! Shazam?

Disclaimer: This Moview consists of scenes that are part of the movie and stories that can spoil the whole thing. Please read at your own risk. Well, c’mon, it’s good, so read…

body:
I’m going to regret this…

Okay so I KNOW I said I was closing requests until I’ve caught up on my drafts and stuff like that. I’m a bit more caught up, I’m hoping to post this 7k+ Lena fic by next week if I’m lucky. BUT I’ve completely fallen in love with Captain Marvel so I’m willing to open requests for Captain Marvel and Brie Larson ONLY. You guys can request anything basically I just wont write about r*pe, under age smut and anything really really triggering. But besides that really go wild!

title: club preview // c.d.
body:
“You’re so wet for me already, are you sure it’s still a good idea to hold back your moans?” With one last hickey to your breasts done, Carol pulled away with a wide smirk to admire the breathless and trembling stare you were in, eager for her to touch you more. “Be a good girl for me.”

That, on both your parts, were a poor choice of words, the bratty side of your mind immediately winning over, not wanting to give her the satisfaction, and not thinking of the consequences it held for you. “Jokes on you love, I’m not the type of person to listen to orders so easily.”

Your defiant gaze, paired with your labored breathing and the light illuminating how wet you were already only made her smirk wider, shrugging and pushing you off of her without hesitation.

“I guess that means you don’t need me to touch you, hmm?” She leaned back into the bed and watched you look at her with hungry eyes, sucking on her fingers that were covered in your juices slowly moving her other hand down her pants, moaning and rolling her body to tempt you. “Hell, I’m fine with just an audience.”
